intro: Lomelosia pseudisetensis, commonly known as the hairy lomelosia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments and has hairy stems and leaves that help protect it from harsh weather conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Lomelosia pseudisetensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
